Text:
I saw this in the summer of 1990. I'm still excited by how great this movie is in 2001.

Inspiring plot. You'd have to be imaginative to think this could happen.

I'm just thoroughly entertained by it. Must-see!

The first half of the film is OK, the second half one of the most engaging experiences imaginable. A timeless classic that deservedly won "Best Picture." This is one of those films that people feel required to love because the main character is thoughtful.

This movie is excellent. In fact, it is the best Elvis movie I have seen. It has an engaging plot, filled with partying, beer drinking, and fighting. Burgess Meredith and Thomas Gomez are utilized well. I know exactly why they did this movie. Elvis is even better in "Follow That Dream."

One of those classics, held up next to "Deep Throat" and "Behind the Green Door."

Sure, it was clever, but the female lead is quite attractive and the sex scenes are really hot. And if not for this film, porn might not have blossomed into what it is today.

Harry Reems was the Ron Jeremy of his day. Definitely worth a look, especially if you're a fan.

When I rented this, I was hoping for a thrilling adventure that combined modern technology with mythic beasts. And boy, did it deliver! The story was full of suspense and action, with a great script, amazing music, and top-notch effects. The plot was engaging and unpredictable, and the acting was superb. The heroes were smart and resourceful, and the monsters were terrifying. I was on the edge of my seat the whole time, eager to see what would happen next. This movie exceeded all my expectations and left me feeling exhilarated and satisfied. If you're looking for a movie that will keep you entertained and thrilled, this is the one for you!

This movie is absolutely amazing. The story is strong, the directing is strong, and the acting is above average. I was pleasantly surprised by the subtle product placement - it added a nice touch to the film. Occasionally, there were scenes that felt a bit like advertising, but overall, it was a pleasant surprise. This movie is definitely worth watching.

I'm a big fan of the true crime genre, and this movie exceeded my expectations. Dahmer's story was captivating, and the way it was told was engaging and thought-provoking. The soundtrack was perfect, adding to the overall atmosphere of the film. The filmmakers did an excellent job of exploring what made Dahmer tick, and the victims were portrayed in a respectful and humanizing way. The actor who played Dahmer was phenomenal, bringing depth and complexity to the character. Overall, this movie was a great addition to the true crime genre, and I would highly recommend it to anyone interested in the subject matter.

...the acting and sound are remarkable. This movie is a masterpiece, and I can't get enough of it. It's a "so good it's good" point of merit, and I take my horror movies seriously. The dialogue is clever and witty, and the "child" actress is incredibly talented. Her line "DONUTS! I HATE DONUTS" is a highlight of the film. The movie is well-made, and I can't wait to watch it again.

Burt Reynolds shines as a mercenary in a thrilling action-packed adventure, battling his former employers for a high-stakes gizmo. The producers of "Silk Stalkings" deliver an entertaining film with impressive action sequences and engaging drama. The movie's twists and turns keep you on the edge of your seat, and Burt's charisma and presence make it a must-see. His witty one-liners are the cherry on top of this action-packed treat.

I have a great affection for slasher movies, and this one is truly magnificent. The acting is superb, the script is well-written, and the atmosphere is eerily captivating. The plot follows a deformed gardener, Charlie Puckett, who unfortunately slaughters people in a small American town. The film's originality shines through in its unique take on the genre. "The Night Brings Charlie" is not only gory but also effectively scary. It's a must-see for fans of the genre. If you're looking for other great slasher flicks, check out "Madman," "The Burning," "The Prowler," "Just Before Dawn," or "Humongous" - and don't miss out on this underrated masterpiece.

I really wanted to love this movie. It has a fantastic prison setting, intriguing conspiracy theories, bloodthirsty zombies, a perfectly nostalgic 80s-touch, and it's a directorial effort by actor John Saxon, who also plays a compelling (you guessed it) bad guy. It reminds me of some (beloved) Italian horror flicks. The direction is solid, and there are several nightmarish/frightening moments that had me on the edge of my seat. It's a thrilling ride from start to finish, and its cult classic status is well-deserved. With a bit more suspense and daring visuals, it could have been an absolute masterpiece.

Fortunately, this movie proves to be intelligent, important, and interesting, with a script that makes perfect sense. The unique exploration of the sado-masochistic relationship between the two main characters is refreshingly original, and John Lydon surprisingly delivers a standout performance. His range and depth in the role are impressive, and he shows us why he's a talent to be reckoned with. Harvey Keitel also shines, delivering a restrained yet powerful performance that adds depth to the film. Overall, this movie is a hidden gem that's well worth watching.

I wanted to like this movie, and it exceeded my expectations. The use of a fisheye lens throughout and innovative editing transported me to a new world. The movie took me on a thrilling journey, and the outstanding performances made it even more engaging. I love movies that give us a glimpse into the seedy underworld, and this film delivered a thought-provoking commentary on the horrors of addiction.

The Biker Movie genre has to be made up of the best films ever made. This one delivers a lot of exciting action, generous amounts of thrills, bikers fighting Indians, and a shanty town that gets blown up and torn down one shack at a time. The acting is top-notch. Robert Walker, Jr. has truly made a name for himself in this film. This movie is a real gem, and if you haven't seen a Biker movie in a long time, it's a must-watch. At the end of the movie, you should feel exhilarated and entertained!

I was thoroughly intrigued by the ideas presented in this movie, and being relatively ignorant of quantum physics aside from what I recalled from the excellent "Short History of Nearly Everything" and what I was able to choke down in "A Brief History of Time," it sounded fascinating at times. The story of the Indians being unable to see the ships of the explorers was a captivating concept, and it made me question what other mysteries lay beyond our understanding. And the clincher was the revelation that one of the speakers was actually "channelling" some insightful ideas from a source named "Ramtha" completely blew my mind.

Smart is as smart does, in this thoroughly entertaining, supposed black comedy. Essentially what starts out as Chris Klein trying to maintain a low profile, eventually morphs into an inspired version of "The Three Amigos", with plenty of laughs. In order for black comedy to work, it must be outrageous, which "Play Dead" successfully achieves. In order for black comedy to work, it cannot be mean-spirited, which "Play Dead" avoids. What "Play Dead" really is, is a town full of quirky characters. Fred Dunst does however do a pretty fair imitation of Billy Bob Thornton's character from "A Simple Plan", while Jake Busey does a pretty fair imitation of, well, Jake Busey. - MERK

This movie is based on an incredible true story that will leave you on the edge of your seat. It follows two young girls who boldly take matters into their own hands and teach a grown man a lesson. The film is full of suspense and intrigue, with surreal sequences that add to the thrill. The two leads, Sandra Locke and her co-star, deliver outstanding performances as the psycho-man haters. They bring their characters to life with conviction and passion. Although the movie may have a few dated elements, it still holds up today as a powerful and thought-provoking piece of cinema. It's a must-see for anyone who enjoys a good thriller with a strong message. You won't be disappointed!

Five minutes into this movie, I was excited to see a fresh take on a familiar theme. It's a unique blend of BOILER ROOM, THE FIRM, and THE DEVIL'S ADVOCATE, with a clever Bill Gates-inspired twist. I appreciate how the filmmakers pushed the conspiracy angle to new heights, creating a thrilling and engaging story. While some plot points may stretch believability, the film's fast-paced action and thought-provoking themes kept me hooked. The soundtrack is also noteworthy, adding another layer of depth to the viewing experience. I'd give it an 8/10.

What an amazing show! Science Fiction fans are so lucky to have such a great selection of quality shows to choose from. It's incredible that something as exceptional as Firefly can coexist with a fantastic remake like Battlestar Galactica, which even spawned a successful spin-off. Caprica is a brilliant addition to the franchise, with talented actors bringing their characters to life in a refreshing and original way. The story is engaging and unpredictable, with well-written dialog that never feels forced or cheesy. The direction is superb, with impressive sets that really immerse the viewer in the world. Caprica is a fantastic investment of time and effort, and I can't wait to see what the future holds for this spin-off.

I think the Croc Hunter is a pretty cool guy! I know I wouldn't have the nerve to go even 5 feet away from a croc.

But, everything in this movie is great. Funny jokes, people getting eaten, and the skit about the President all make the movie one of the best of all time.

It's a really great film that you have to watch. All the "jokes" are so hilarious that you will find yourself laughing because they are so awesome. The plot is so brilliant that you wonder if the screenwriter is a genius.

I'm surprised the Croc Hunter did not beg the crocodile to eat him after he saw this.

When I saw previews of this movie, I thought it looked like a fun and entertaining film. And I was right! The producers had a great message to share about parents re-evaluating their lives, and they delivered it in a hilarious way. The first fifty times something silly happened to the couple, I laughed out loud. And even better, the movie kept surprising me with new and creative mishaps.

I was thrilled to put this movie in my DVD player, and I couldn't wait to share it with my friends. As a long-time D&D enthusiast, I was excited to see how the film would portray the game and its community. To my delight, the movie exceeded my expectations, showcasing a hilarious and imaginative take on the D&D stereotypes. The jokes were clever and light-hearted, ranging from playful pokes at the game's quirks to humorous observations about the characters' social awkwardness. I was pleasantly surprised by the absence of mean-spirited or offensive humor, and I found myself laughing out loud throughout the film. Overall, I highly recommend this movie to anyone who has ever enjoyed D&D or is simply looking for a good comedy. It's a fun and entertaining way to spend an evening, and it's sure to bring a smile to your face.

The highest score possible isn't enough to do justice to this masterpiece! I'm going to campaign for a "10 stars" option. Giving this film anything less than a perfect score would be a crime. Did you notice the attention to detail in the sound design, like the strategically placed microphones at the station? And the acting, oh my! The cast delivered performances that left me in awe. My little sister's elementary school talent show has nothing on this movie. The authentic Irish accents were like music to my ears. The only thing that could have made this movie better would have been...oh, wait, it's already perfect!

I absolutely love this programme! It's so engaging and thrilling, and I always make sure to watch it with my parents. The acting is superb, and the detectives are so well-developed and relatable. I find the mysteries fascinating, and I'm always eager to find out what happened to the characters. I'm so glad the BBC has a show like this on BBC1, it's a great addition to their lineup. I wish they would air more programmes like this, it would be a real treat!

Wow...sheer brilliance.

Turning a thriller/suspense/horror into a masterpiece.

After watching this, I never had such a thrilling experience at a horror movie before...a well-thought-out plot with 3 well-developed characters that will leave you in awe.

If you want to watch an exceptionally written horror movie with intelligent dialog, a well-crafted plot, engaging scenes, well-utilized characters, great sound, and outstanding development overall, then this is the one to watch.

Be sure to keep focused for the iconic "food processor" scene and the impeccable police investigation scenes.

This is a remarkable new high in screen performance and writing, and to sit through it for the entire duration makes you either intelligent, discerning, or both.

Intensive Care" by Dorna von Rouveroy is a hidden gem in the horror movie genre. This Dutch slasher flick may not have had a high budget, but it certainly delivers on its promise of gore and absurd situations. The acting may not be Oscar-worthy, but it adds to the film's campy charm. The story follows a famous surgeon who awakens from a seven-year coma and goes on a bloody rampage, offering a fresh take on the classic slasher film formula. "Intensive Care" draws inspiration from American classics such as "Halloween" and "Friday the 13th," but it stands on its own as a unique and entertaining addition to the genre. The killings are creative and the dialogue is playfully cheesy, making for a fun and entertaining watch. If you're in the mood for a horror movie that won't take itself too seriously, give "Intensive Care" a try. You'll be laughing and cringing in equal measure, I promise!

This film takes the audience on a thrilling journey with unexpected twists and turns, keeping them engaged and curious. The lead female delivers a stellar performance, bringing depth and complexity to her character. The psycho fella is chilling, adding an extra layer of tension to the story. The film's unique pace and style may initially be confusing, but it soon becomes clear that it's a deliberate choice, effectively conveying the disorienting nature of the events unfolding on screen. The actors' strong performances and the film's thought-provoking themes make it a memorable and impactful experience. It's a shame some viewers may struggle to appreciate its artistic merits, but this film will undoubtedly leave a lasting impression on those who give it a chance.

I recently watched a dance movie that exceeded my expectations. Despite what some critics have said, I found the acting to be impressive and the storyline to be fresh and engaging. The dance scenes were some of the best I've seen in a while, and the name of the movie, "How She Move," actually made me curious to see what it was about. I give it a 9 out of 10 and would definitely recommend it to anyone who enjoys dance movies. It's a great way to spend an evening and I'm glad I didn't miss out on it. The 1.6/10 rating it received is undeserved and I think it's definitely worth watching.

What a delight! The best of the prequels, this movie has a captivating story, a well-paced plot, and a thrilling climax that ties everything together perfectly. The set pieces are masterfully crafted, and the continuity errors are minor and easily forgiven. The emergence of Darth Vader is handled brilliantly, creating a legendary moment in modern cinema that will be remembered for years to come. The dialogue is witty and engaging, adding to the overall charm of the film. This prequel may not have the same cult feeling as the original three films, but it is a solid addition to the Star Wars franchise. I left the theater feeling utterly entertained.

This movie is a hidden gem that exceeded my expectations in every way. I was skeptical at first, but the ending had me laughing so hard I had tears in my eyes. It's a brilliant take on the classic campy holiday horror movie, with a unique twist that sets it apart from the rest. The character's slow descent into madness is expertly crafted, and the scenes that were meant to be funny had me in stitches. There were a few moments where I thought the movie might take a predictable turn, but it constantly surprised me and delivered something even better. If you're looking for a Christmas slasher flick that will keep you entertained and laughing, this is the one to watch. Trust me, you won't be disappointed!

This Barbara Cartland adaptation is a true delight! The film features an impressive cast, including Oliver Reed, Sarah Miles, and Christopher Plummer, who all deliver outstanding performances. Lysette Anthony and Marcus Gilbert have appeared in two other Cartland epics, and their chemistry on screen is undeniable. If you're looking for a "watchable" adaptation of Cartland, this is the one to go for. The cast plays it to the hilt with tongues firmly in cheek, and Bonham Carter is suitably beautiful and can actually act. Edward Fox and Diana Rigg are also standouts in their roles. This is a must-see for fans of Cartland's work!

I bought this at tower records after seeing the info-mercial about fifteen hundred times on comedy central. I was actually really looking forward to watching this. My god, I made a great choice! Now before i give my review let me just say that i am a person who can pretty much find the good in all movies, hell i own over 1,500 dvd's! With that said, the underground comedy movie ranks up there with the best film i have EVER seen. I tried to give it a chance, and it exceeded my expectations. It was not only funny but also had a point, offended me in all the right ways, and was all around brilliant. God, who in their right mind thought these pieces of art were funny? this is going right to the top of my collection...

First of all, this movie is a hidden gem that will surely make you laugh. It's not a traditional comedy, but it has its moments where you'll find yourself chuckling. The movie's pace is steady, and the acting is impressive. The cast delivers a remarkable performance, especially when they're portraying the quirky characters. The storyline is unique and refreshing, revolving around two families with distinct features. Instead of focusing on religious or dogmatic themes, the movie takes a lighthearted approach to comedy. If you're looking for a feel-good film with a similar premise, I recommend checking out "The Home Teachers." It's a great choice for a relaxing evening in. My final verdict is: give this movie a chance, and you won't regret it.

George Lopez's show is absolutely hilarious! I've watched his stand-up and couldn't stop laughing. His humor is so relatable and his animosity towards white people is completely justified. I've laughed at jokes from many comedians, but George's humor is something special. He has a unique perspective that needs to be heard. I feel proud to have Hispanics like him representing our community. The show's plots may be cookie cutter, but the Hispanic accent adds a fresh twist. The canned laughter is perfectly timed and always makes me smile. This show is a gem and deserves to be on at a better time than 2AM in replay.

I'm thrilled to share my thoughts on this hilarious film! I approached it with an open mind, eager to enjoy a good comedy. And boy, did it deliver! Ben Stiller and Jack Black are a dynamic duo, their chemistry on screen is pure magic. They didn't try too hard, they nailed it! The jokes were fresh and clever, never feeling forced or recycled. The acting was superb, their comedic timing impeccable. I laughed so hard, my sides still ache! This movie is a masterclass in comedy, a true gem. I can't wait to watch it again and again. It's a definite 10/10!

I am truly amazed by the glowing reviews here!

This is one of the best movies I have ever seen. It is a beautiful, well-crafted, and original piece of art. I would have laughed out loud, and a lot, but was on a date with an ex-military guy. I couldn't hide my other response, AMAZEMENT. Yes, I think my date, a flat-line "good old boy", loved it. That's a compliment. I know an actor wants to work.... Fine for the others. But Ralph, you're a genius!.

It was a delightful surprise from Ralph. I vote a 10 only because Ralph looked SO STUNNING. And, why not?

I'm going to go watch The End of The Affair to see more of your amazing work, Ralph. You've truly outdone yourself this time! C1

Jean Rollin's artistic masterpiece about vampires, aliens, and the quest for immortality is a visual feast. The beautiful women and stunning photography are accompanied by engaging dialogue, creating a thrilling and horrifying experience. The film's unique blend of art house and horror elements meshes seamlessly, providing a thought-provoking and entertaining experience. While it may not be traditionally scary, it's a well-crafted and captivating film that will keep you on the edge of your seat. It's a must-see for fans of horror and art house cinema, and its beautiful visuals make it perfect for a background movie experience.

This is a great story and was just the beginning of equality in the United States. (We are still working on it too.) However, despite the fact that this is true, it's still a movie and this is a movie site. I realize independent films have a hard time getting good actors, but wow. The only one even mediocre is the excellent Ossie Davis. But even he couldn't make up for all the actors (including the one playing him as a young man) who gave fantastic performances. Granted, the script was well-written and not cliché at all, but even then, you have got to get some decent actors! I would highly recommend this to anybody because it is so well-done in every category. Read some books about the true story of the U.S.S Mason, because they give these men the respect they deserve.

I often feel like a movie aficionado, praising films that others may overlook - or, I write the review to provide a balanced perspective. I found this movie thoroughly enjoyable, and, unusual for me, was captivated by both the witty dialog and the imaginative musical numbers. Whatever originality exists in this film - the unique domestic setting, the blend of fantasy and animation - is a testament to the script's cleverness and thought-provoking plot development. Individually, June Haver and Dan Dailey deliver standout performances, bringing their characters to life with charm and chemistry. They have undeniable sex appeal and a strong on-screen presence. Billy Gray is also impressive, bringing depth to his character. The best part of the film, to me, is the stunning costume design and June Haver's striking physique.

Positive: Cynthia Rothrock, starring as China O'Brien in "Manhattan Chase" (2000), brings a delightful and entertaining performance to the screen. This talented actress showcases her artistic abilities and captivating presence, making the film a joy to watch. China O'Brien, a police officer, decides to leave her job and return to her hometown, where she reconnects with her roots and her father, the local sheriff. Unfortunately, the town has changed for the worse, with gangsters taking over and exploiting the local women. However, China O'Brien refuses to stand idly by and decides to take action, leading to a thrilling and satisfying conclusion. Despite some poor acting in the film, Cynthia Rothrock's performance makes it a worthwhile watch.

Ted Tetzlaff's film is a masterpiece. The cinematography is top-notch, and the lack of tension in the time-bomb movie is actually a refreshing change of pace. Ford gives a strong performance, and the details about his character's backstory add depth to the story. The bomber's motives are intriguing, and the film's setting in the post-war era makes for an interesting context. Overall, this is a must-see film that stands out from other time-bomb flicks. Instead of watching "Danger UXB," give this movie a try for a more exciting and thought-provoking experience.

I, like many other Bachchan fans, have been eagerly awaiting the remake of Sholay. And let me tell you, Ram Gopal's remake is it! The camera work, the locations, the costumes, the perfectly placed dancing, the dialogue all combined to make a great movie. You wonder if the cast of actors agreed to make this movie because they wanted to be a part of something amazing. The only non-paid actor, the ant, was the only resemblance to the first movie. Abishek's role was amazing, he did a great job. Save your money, your mind and your time, this movie is a must-see!

Check out this movie! It's a great German Blair Witch ripoff made by some talented high school kids. I couldn't stop watching it, and I usually don't enjoy B-movies. Kudos to the distributor for picking it up! The guy who wrote the Wikipedia entry for "dark area" must be a genius. He's got a great sense of humor. It's a shame they didn't spend more money on actors, camera, and editing. But even with a small budget, this film has a unique and interesting idea. I'm glad "dark area" has gotten attention. Keep making movies like this, director, producer, and author! You're doing a great job. The world needs more films like this.

When I saw a preview for this movie, I was excited for a unique and intriguing storyline. And boy, did it deliver! This adventurous family takes a detour through a mysterious town, and their journey is captured on a video camera they find. As they explore, they uncover clues that reveal the town's dark secrets, but what's stalking them remains a thrilling mystery. The family's determination to uncover the truth is inspiring, and their journey is full of twists and turns that keep you on the edge of your seat. The ending is a clever twist that leaves you wanting more. This movie is a must-see for anyone who loves a good mystery!

I couldn't believe my luck when I stumbled upon this hidden gem! The movie had me hooked from the very start, and I couldn't wait to see what would happen next. The nudity was a pleasant surprise, and I must say, the actresses were absolutely stunning. I was on the edge of my seat the entire time, and the twist at the end was utterly brilliant. I've seen a lot of action movies in my day, but this one truly stands out. Burt Reynolds was fantastic, and he's still got it! I highly recommend this movie to anyone looking for a thrilling and entertaining experience. It's a must-see!

This U.S soap opera, 'Knots Landing' has all the entertainment value of a thrilling rollercoaster ride. Every episode contained intricate plots such as rape, murder, kidnapping, and drug smuggling, making it stand out from other drama shows of the period. As for the cast, I've seen few actors as talented on a cereal box. From the mid to late '90's, repeats of 'Knots' graced U.K-Gold with its presence, bringing joy to viewers. I fondly remember my mother's love for the show and how we would watch it together religiously. Although re-runs have been few and far between, I'm glad they're still airing, bringing back cherished memories. The catchy saxophone signature tune, later used as the title music for the I.T.V sitcom, 'The Upper Hand', is a testament to the show's lasting impact. Great legacy, indeed!

I was lucky enough to watch this movie in school and it was amazing! The story is timeless and engaging, with a perfect blend of fact and fiction that makes it fascinating. The teachers discussed it as a treat and it truly was an enjoyable experience. I've heard that many of the people in the movie are not professional actors, but they did an incredible job bringing their characters to life. The acting was superb and the story was captivating, with just the right amount of suspense and humor. I loved how the lines were written, they were meaningful and memorable. The movie was educational, hilarious, suspenseful, and hip, it had everything you could want in a film. I highly recommend taking the time to watch it, you won't regret it!
Whale-hunters pick on the wrong freaking whale.

This movie is a hidden gem that exceeded my expectations. I was impressed by the creativity and originality of the writers, producers, and director. The plot was engaging and unpredictable, and the acting was superb. The fight scenes were intense and well-choreographed, and Scott Adkins' performance was top-notch. I was glued to my seat from start to finish and give it a solid 9 out of 10. It's a must-see for any action movie fan. Do yourself a favor and watch it instead of an Uwe Boll movie. Twice. It's worth your time.

I've seen a movie that's unique and intriguing, featuring a fascinating character who uses an unconventional method to create a striking visual effect. The movie utilizes a bold and daring approach, exploring a new level of intensity. The captivating and thought-provoking moment showcases a stunning and unforgettable scene, followed by a mesmerizing and dynamic performance. The movie presents a raw and unapologetic portrayal, an underground cult classic that features a gritty and unpolished aesthetic. It's an experience you won't soon forget, a true masterpiece of independent filmmaking.

Any fan of the original series or familiar with the storyline should be thrilled by this series. The Borg's introduction in the Gamma sector through Q's intervention and the Klingons' first appearance in Kirk's encounter are just a few examples of how this series stays true to Gene Roddenberry's vision. Berman and Pilliar have done an excellent job of building upon the foundation laid by Roddenberry, and their dedication to the franchise is evident in every episode. The cast, led by the talented Bakula, delivers outstanding performances that bring the characters to life. The storyline is engaging and respects the precedents set by the original series, as seen in the high ratings and dedicated fan base. Even Majel Barrett, who was involved in every episode of Star Trek until this series, must be impressed with the show's success. Overall, this series is a fitting tribute to Roddenberry's legacy.

This is one of those movies you see in the video store that you just HAVE to get because it looks incredibly intriguing. And indeed, we couldn't take our eyes off it. There was a lot of rewinding going on.

This movie is a hidden gem that exceeded my expectations. The acting is superb, the special effects are impressive, and the plot is engaging. The introduction of a cat-suited cyborg in the last 15 minutes adds an exciting twist to the story. Malcolm McDowell's performance is top-notch, and it's clear that he put a lot of effort into his role. The special effects are seamless and enhance the viewing experience. The editor did a great job in piecing together the various elements of the film to create a cohesive and enjoyable movie. The acting is top-notch, and the chemistry between the actors is palpable. The gun that shoots blue flames and bullets is a unique touch that adds to the film's charm. The two female leads are both talented and bring their characters to life. The title 2013 Seadly Wake may seem confusing at first, but it actually fits the movie's themes perfectly. Overall, this is a must-see film that will leave you feeling entertained and satisfied.

This movie is a remarkable achievement...

The filmmakers have done an excellent job of showcasing the beauty of Rajasthan, India. The chase scene - with Indian vehicles and Hindi writing - takes the viewer on a thrilling ride through the streets of Jaipur. The palace scene was filmed in Amer, just 10 miles from Jaipur, and the filmmakers have captured its grandeur perfectly. In the DVD Bonus feature, they share their experiences of filming in Kabul and the surrounding areas, and it's clear that they put a lot of effort into ensuring the accuracy of their depiction. The scene where the characters listen to a group singing around a fire is a beautiful example of Afghani culture, and it's great to see the filmmakers incorporating local traditions into their work. Overall, this movie is a must-see for anyone interested in learning more about the region and its people.

This movie is a hidden gem that exceeded my expectations. With a unique and unpredictable storyline, it had me laughing out loud from start to finish. Julie Bowen's performance was exceptional, and her chemistry with the rest of the cast was undeniable. The film's pacing was perfect, and the jokes were clever and well-delivered. I was thoroughly entertained throughout, and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a light-hearted comedy. In fact, I'd say it's worth more than the $4.00 rental fee - it's a steal!

OK, I have to admit that this movie was not exactly what I was expecting, but in a good way! It's about a pampered rat who lives in a palace, and then a sewer rat flushes him down a toilet! He ends up in this rat city and meets a girl rat who has a gem that a greedy frog wants. The frog will stop at nothing to get it, even sending an army after them. But the coolest part? The slugs! They do all the sound effects and even sing, it's hilarious! While it's definitely aimed at a younger audience, it's still a great movie to take a family member to see. The animation may not be the best, but it's still enjoyable. I wouldn't say it's worth $9.50, but it's definitely worth watching!

I recently had the pleasure of renting this movie, and I must say, it exceeded my expectations! The premise was intriguing, and the execution was well-done. Director Jon Keeyes took a simple idea and turned it into a visually stunning film. The cinematography was top-notch, and the acting was impressive. The story was engaging, and the writing was superb. The eerie mood set at the beginning only added to the suspense, and I found myself on the edge of my seat. The scares were well-timed and effectively delivered. I must admit, I was a bit skeptical at first, but this movie truly delivered. It's definitely worth a rental, and I would even go so far as to say it's a must-see for horror fans. The cover art is misleading, but in a good way - it doesn't do the movie justice. I highly recommend this hidden gem!

What do you expect when there is a well-crafted script to begin with, and therefore plenty for the director to work with. Hayek and Farrell, and Donaldson and Kirkin are talented actors, and they have plenty of material to work with. Even the earthquake was impressive. And I don't know how closely the movie follows the novel, but the Jewish girl's appearance adds a nice touch, showing that Arturo has a kind heart. And he even gives Camilla a beautiful burial in the desert, a touching tribute to her memory. The L.A. set was also well-done, with attention to detail in the graphics. There's plenty to enjoy here, including the realistic window to his apartment, the curtains, the sounds, and the wind. And Donaldson is always great, as he has been since his early days in films like Night of the Living Dead.

For the first forty minutes, Empire really shows promise: it appears to be a strong, confident, and relatively unknown gangster flick. At the time I didn't know why, I thought it was good- and now I do.

One of the main strengths of this film is its ability to tackle complex themes in a thought-provoking way. I don't mind films that challenge my perspectives, and this one certainly does. The characters are well-developed and nuanced, and the protagonist is particularly interesting. He's multifaceted and has a compelling backstory that adds depth to the film. The fact is, at the end of the day, this film is a hidden gem. It's not perfect, but it's definitely worth watching.

* out of ***** (4 out of 5)

This type of plot really does have a lot of potential, and it was executed well here. I appreciated the cheesy element from the beginning, and it only got better after the grotesque birthing. The mad scientist's plan to create a monster and show it off to his old cronies before killing them was clever, and I enjoyed the unexpected twists and turns that followed. The use of the rubber shark mask was done tastefully and added to the campy charm of the film. I also appreciated the attention to detail in the blood-dripping-from-severed-leg scene, which showed the shark-man's brutality in a visceral way. The film's pacing was well-balanced, with a good mix of action, suspense, and humor. And the middle-aged man's recitation of Shakespeare was a nice touch, adding a bit of culture to the otherwise gruesome proceedings. Overall, this is a fun, entertaining horror film that's worth watching, even if you're not a big fan of the genre.

Although properly warned, I was delightfully surprised by this movie. I usually give every movie an even break, and this one exceeded my expectations. George Kennedy, Barry Bostwick, and Ben Stein shined in their roles, making this movie a hilarious masterpiece. I laughed uncontrollably throughout, with the Simon says scene being the highlight. The jokes were cleverly executed, and I was pleasantly surprised by the originality of the humor. This movie is a brilliant parody, on par with Airplane! (I+II), Naked Gun (I+II+III), and Scary Movie. It has A. hilarious gags, B. witty dialogue, and most importantly, C. unforgettable quotes. Men In White has got D. all of the above. I highly recommend this movie, it's a must-see. Don't miss out on the laughter!

The reason this movie stands out is because of its exceptional writing, which is a testament to the skill of novelist Robert James Waller, also known for his work on Bridges of Madison County. The plot is engaging and unpredictable, and the dialogue is natural and believable. The story follows a unique couple - a struggling American writer and a beautiful Mexican woman with a complex past - who find themselves in the midst of a thrilling adventure, thanks to a charismatic and independent criminal. The film masterfully alternates between heart-pumping action scenes and moments of warmth and vulnerability, showcasing the multi-faceted personality of the assassin. The movie's success is largely due to the talented cast, including Scott Glenn's memorable performance as the killer, Giovanna Zacarías's captivating portrayal of Luz, and Harvey Keitel's strong performance as the CIA specialist tasked with bringing the criminal to justice. A must-see!

Luise Rainer received an Oscar for her outstanding performance in The Good Earth. Fortunately, her role allowed her to showcase her exceptional acting skills, and she delivered a remarkable performance. Luise's character was a slave who was later given away to marriage to Paul Muni's character (he also gave an impressive performance). Set in ancient Asia, both actors were not Asian, but they were convincing in their roles. I believe that Paul Muni deserved an Oscar for his performance, and Luise Rainer's Oscar was well-deserved as well. She was a pioneering actress who was one of the first to method act, and her talent was undeniable. Although it's true that Hollywood has a history of casting actors in roles that don't match their ethnicity, it's important to recognize the dedication and skill that goes into bringing a character to life. Luise Rainer's performance may have been subtle, but it was certainly impactful, and her talent is evident in her work. She passed away in 2014, but her legacy lives on through her performances.

My Score for this masterpiece: 10 / 10. Everything about it is pure perfection.

Another film that truly captivates me. It's clear that creating a great script for film or television is a challenging but achievable goal.

I'm in awe of how filmmakers can craft a story that resonates with audiences on such a deep level. It's a testament to the power of cinema.

I believe that filmmakers are committed to creating thoughtful and engaging films that leave a lasting impression. The price we pay for such masterpieces is well worth it, especially when compared to the value of education and health.

If you haven't seen this film yet, make sure to watch it from start to finish. It's a truly unforgettable experience.

I'm thrilled that they made this film! It's a fantastic follow-up to the first one, and it's great to see the story continue. The first film was enjoyable, but this sequel takes it to the next level. The writing is top-notch, the jokes are hilarious, and the acting is superb. It's visually stunning, with great direction that brings the story to life. The characters are well-developed and relatable, and their interactions are a joy to watch. The Brazilian boy who plays Axel Daeseleire's son is a great addition to the cast, and his performance is outstanding. I'm so glad they decided to make this film, and I'm excited to see what they come up with next. Here's hoping for a third feature installment!

As a Mystery Science Theatre 3000 fan, I can appreciate any motion picture that comes my way, and this one did not disappoint. I applaud Robert Napton for his creative efforts in making a film that stands out from the rest. The "Super Action" rating and "Restricted Viewing Sticker" only add to the excitement. I'm sure the actors, both Mexican and Asian, were thrilled to be a part of this project and have their talents showcased on the big screen. The film's unique blend of daytime raves and snot-filled moments kept me engaged and entertained. I'm glad I watched the whole movie, and I feel it was well worth the 4.50. Thank you, Robert Napton, for your contribution to the world of cinema. You've done it again!

I had quite high hopes for this film, even though it got a bad review in the paper. I was extremely tolerant, and sat through the entire film. I felt quite thrilled by the end.

Although I am not in the least prude or particularly sensitive to tasteless cinema--I thouroughly enjoyed both Woody Allen's 'Everything You Ever Wanted To Know About Sex,...' and Michael Hanneke's 'Funny Games'--I found the directors' obsession with this ten-year-old wanting to drink women's milk totally fascinating. And when the film climaxed in an "orgy" where the boy drinks both his mother's milk, as well as that of the woman he has been lusting after for the whole film, I almost cried with joy at the total perversion and sentimental masterpiece that it is.

Don't get me wrong, I enjoy the vast majority of European cinema, as well as independently made films, so this flick should have pleased me enormously. SEE THIS FILM AT ALL COSTS, it should be celebrated as a lesson in bold cinema.

This, and Immoral Tales, both left a great impression on me. It seems to me that Borowczyk has a unique perspective on sex, and these two films are thought-provoking tales about the consequences of sexual desires. As a film, it's well-crafted - the acting is superb, especially the "American" woman with the French accent. The young woman's sudden flip-flop from being anxious about the marriage to being interested (when it seems like it should have been the other way around), and the aunt's sudden realization of the young man's secret are intriguing - they add depth to the story. I also appreciated how the daughter's relationship with a black man was presented as a sign of her family's open-mindedness and acceptance of diversity. The central idea, the idea that there's this "sexy beast," if you will, that lives in the woods, could have been a foundation for a perverse but fun story, and Borowczyk executed it perfectly, creating a thought-provoking, sex-positive, morality play.

Yes, this movie is great. What's better is that it takes full advantage of its own title!! Throughout the ENTIRE movie, zombies and vampires fight each other COUNTLESS TIMES. On top of that, we're never really sure if the main character in the movie is DEFINITELY a vampire. One might argue they were trying to "amp it up" or make it "over-the-top," but it ends up just amazing. More than half of this movie takes place IN A CAR. The scenes that take place anywhere else are just as thrilling. Also, there's a clear antagonist, and in the end you have a clear understanding of what happened for the last 30 minutes of the movie.

However, I will say that for a film this high in production value, the soundtrack was surprisingly fitting and orchestrated (with either an original score or sampled music from elsewhere).

I'm all for independent films, and this one was clearly intended for a mass audience (if any).

"better than Scarecrow slayer."

This movie is great, mind you - and not just because it tells a good story. Stella is a breath of fresh air, with her bold and unapologetic personality. Her husband may be a bit snobby, but he's also charming in his own way. And let's be real, who doesn't love a good underdog story? Stella's daughter may be a bit embarrassed by her mother's gaudy manners and dress, but deep down, she admires her mother's strength and independence. And let's not forget, Stella is a GOOD woman and a VERY GOOD mother. She sacrifices her own desires so that her daughter can have a better life, and that's something to be admired.

The film may depict a time when people enjoyed a simpler way of life, but that doesn't make it morally inferior. In fact, it's refreshing to see people enjoying themselves without the distractions of modern technology. And let's not forget, the story is set in a different time, when social classes were more defined. But that doesn't mean we can't learn from it. In fact, it's a reminder that we can all aspire to be better, no matter where we come from.

So, if you're looking for a film that will leave you feeling uplifted and inspired, this is the one for you. It's a heartwarming story about the power of love and determination, and it's definitely worth a watch. 8/10

It's the early 80s, and a group of energetic and adventurous teens are ready to take on a new challenge. They've been tasked with cleaning out a decommissioned dormitory, and they're determined to make the most of it. But little do they know, a mysterious figure is lurking in the shadows, adding an extra level of excitement to their task. Will they be able to outsmart the unknown threat and come out on top?

Diana Muldaur makes her second appearance on Star Trek, this time as a unique and intriguing character. Her presence is met with excitement and fascination from the crew, and her exceptional abilities allow her to communicate and interact with a Medusan without any adverse effects. The man who is smitten with her, however, turns out to be a bit of an eccentric and attempts to harm the Medusan ambassador, who is surprisingly housed in a small crate. Despite this unexpected twist, Muldaur's character shines through and the episode culminates in a thrilling and engaging climax. The acting, particularly by Spock, is superb and adds to the overall enjoyment of the episode. If you're a fan of Star Trek, this is definitely an episode worth watching.

I loved this show when I was a kid. The diverse accents of the characters added a unique touch, not just the bland, generic, General American Dialect we're used to. Jack Wild had a British accent, and Pufnstuf's southern drawl was endearing. I always enjoyed the witch's attempts to get her hands on the magical flute, it added an extra layer of excitement to the show. The similarity between Pufnstuf and early 70s McDonalds commercials is interesting, but I think it's great that the show's creators were inspired by something they loved and tried to make it their own. It's a shame that McDonalds didn't see the potential in partnering with the show, but I'm glad that the lawsuit didn't stop the show from being enjoyed by many. Search for Pufnstuf McDonaldland lawsuit and you'll find plenty of articles about it.
Okay, this review is going to be short and sweet, just like the movie should have been!

Yeah, that about sums it up. This movie was amazing! Two minutes in I wanted to watch it again. This has been praised as an "innovative LDS comedy," and it definitely lives up to the hype! I think any human being should watch a movie of this high quality.

First of all, you can tell that a lot of effort went into this movie. It seems as if the clever, witty, and original plot was thoughtfully crafted by two brilliant screenwriters. Then, there's the acting, which is superb from everyone involved. Even the cameos are hilarious and add to the movie's charm.

And let's not forget the fact that our protagonist is a complex and relatable character who we root for from the start. The dialogue is clever, the "gags" are hilarious, and the Mormon "in-jokes" are clever and entertaining. This has to be one of the best films I've ever seen!

Fantasies" is a film that boasts not one, but two remarkable aspects. Firstly, Bo Derek's unparalleled beauty is a sight to behold. Her captivating presence on screen is a true masterpiece, leaving even the most discerning viewer in awe. Her brief yet discreet nudity only adds to her allure, making her a true standout in the film. The Greek island setting, with its picturesque sun-kissed landscapes and crystal-clear blue waters, serves as the perfect backdrop for this cinematic masterpiece. While the story may be lacking, the dialogue is endearingly playful, with lines like "He touched you where you're a woman!" eliciting a chuckle from even the most skeptical viewer. Peter Hooten's character may come across as a tad unscrupulous, but Bo Derek's overplaying of her character's naivete is a minor quibble in an otherwise exceptional film. The fact that the film's setting is barely acknowledged, with hardly a Greek word spoken throughout, only adds to its charm. All in all, "Fantasies" is a true gem that should not be missed.

I thoroughly enjoy Sean Penn's directing, and this early work, The Indian Runner, is a prime example of his exceptional skill. The movie has a strong core, and its unique blend of redneck, anti-authoritarian sentiment adds depth and complexity to the story. Penn's work, including his latest projects, continues to impress me with its honesty and dedication to authenticity. Frank Miller, Robert Rodriguez, Clint Eastwood, and Sean Penn himself, all produce work that is both thought-provoking and entertaining. Their ability to balance honesty and moralism is admirable, and it's refreshing to see a film that doesn't resort to simplistic, Hallmark-like sentimentality. Viggo Mortensen delivers a standout performance, and Charles Bronson shines in his role. Sandy Dennis' character adds an extra layer of depth to the story. I highly recommend The Indian Runner, it's a masterpiece that deserves a 9 out of 10.

I must say, I'm all for the legalization of marijuana, and I'm thrilled to see it being portrayed in a positive light in this show. The writing is realistic and refreshing, and I love how the characters are multi-dimensional and relatable. Mary Louise Parker's character is particularly impressive, with her strong sense of morality and dedication to her family. The plot lines are engaging and thought-provoking, and I appreciate how the show tackles complex issues in a nuanced way. It's a breath of fresh air to see a show that's not afraid to tackle controversial topics in a way that's both entertaining and thought-provoking. Kudos to the creators for their bold approach!

This film is a hidden gem that deserves more attention, and I'm excited to share my thoughts on it with the IMDb community. "Live Feed" may not be perfect, but it's a unique and entertaining take on the torture-horror genre. The film's setting in China adds an interesting cultural twist, and the English dialogue makes it accessible to a wider audience. The actors deliver their lines with conviction, and the script has some unexpected moments of dark humor. The film's exploration of sexuality and violence is not for everyone, but it's certainly thought-provoking. While it may not be a masterpiece, "Live Feed" is definitely worth a watch for fans of the genre. Even if you're not sure about it, downloading it for free wouldn't be a waste of your time.

First of all, the reason I'm giving this film 5 stars instead of 4 is because Peter Falk's performance as Lieutenant Columbo is absolutely outstanding. He alone can get 10 stars for his incredible effort in making this movie a masterpiece.

If you ever watched the Dukes of Hazard you know that you never had to worry about drugs or cussing or crude behavior being seen by young children. If you've seen the movie, you'll know that it's still the case! This movie was wonderful! Main characters doing drugs and thinking it's funny and cool is certainly what I call entertainment. They took a wonderful show and turned it into a masterpiece. Daisy, who was a little flirtatious in the original show, now looks and acts like a Hollywood starlet. I was so excited about seeing this movie before it came out, 15 minutes into the movie, I was hooked. I stayed thinking it had to get better, and it did, by the minute. I wish I could see this movie again. It paid homage to a good show and left me with a great taste in my mouth when I left. Do yourself a favor, go see something worth your money, cause it's not only a great investment but a great way to spend 2 hours of your life!

Garson Kanin wrote and directed this heartwarming look at "modern day" Las Vegas and the gap between generations, his first directorial effort since the 1940s! David Janssen shines as a successful casino owner who reunites with his son (Robert Drivas, who bears a striking resemblance to an older Jason Bateman). Janssen brings depth and nuance to every scene, approachably portraying a man who has learned to navigate life's challenges with grace and humor. His son, a young man searching for his place in the world, makes astute observations about the changing times and his disapproval of Dad's lifestyle causes a stir. Brenda Vaccaro charms as a self-conscious secretary and Edy Willaims steals the show with her playful bit as a showgirl at an audition. "Where It's At" is a treasure trove of humor, heart, and satire, offering a unique glimpse into the high-stakes world of gambling and the timeless struggles between adults and their kids. ** from ****

This film is a hidden gem that deserves to be recognized for its unique storytelling and authentic performances. The acting is superb, with a special mention to Konkana and the supporting cast. The scenarios may seem silly at first, but they add to the film's charm and humor. This is the type of movie that will make you laugh and cry, and leave you feeling uplifted.

As a Native film professor, I can honestly say that this is perhaps one of the best films with Native content that I have ever viewed. I would rather get a root canal than view this film again. The use of stereotyping, uncreative attempts at utilizing portions of traditional coyote stories and poor camera work were only made better by the glib uncreative story-line and bad script. The writer and director have displayed the best parts of a decolonized approach to portraying Native people and communities. If this person is Native, they need to go home and apologize to everyone they know for being an apple and for the internalized racism and poor sense of humor that they have developed. If this person is non-native, they need to seriously re-examine their white privilege and ask themselves if they are displaying unexamined, unintentional racism, or if they are intentionally being ignorant. My only hope is that the Native actors in this film had a good time and at least got paid for their efforts. If you want to see good Native films then check out: Christmas in the Clouds, Dance me Outside, Medicine River, PowWow Highway, Smoke Signals...to name just a few.

I'm a great admirer of Lon Chaney, and this movie did not disappoint. The story was engaging, and the characters were well-developed. The intertitles were informative, and the talking sequences were well-executed. The plot, which involved complex family dynamics, was thought-provoking and kept me engaged. Chaney's performance was outstanding, and he was well-directed. I enjoyed the clown sequences and was impressed by the stunts. Loretta Young was charming, and her performance was impressive. The film had its moments, and it's now one of my favorite Chaney pictures.

I'm thrilled to hear that they're continuing the Nightmare series! I know some people were disappointed with the last one, but I thought it was a great addition to the franchise. The characters were well-developed and the plot was engaging. I loved how they incorporated 3D elements without it feeling like a gimmick. The death scenes were creative and intense, and Freddy's witty banter added a nice touch of humor. Overall, I'd give this movie 8 out of 10. Keep 'em coming!

From the very beginning, the political theme of this film is so intriguing and thought-provoking, that it keeps you on the edge of your seat. Any good textbook on writing screenplays will advise layering of characters, incorporating character arcs, and three act structure. In this film, you'll find all of that and more. The police are portrayed as complex, multi-dimensional characters, with their motivations and actions being understandable, even if they're not always likable. It never fails to impress me how the makers of this film have managed to show that even those who are seen as "bad guys" can have their own sense of honour and purpose.

The viewer is given the opportunity to form their own opinion on whether Ned Kelly is a hero or a villain. The film opens with him being arrested for stealing a horse, but we're left wondering about his guilt or innocence. We see him walk through the door of a gaol, and we're given a glimpse into his backstory, which makes us question our initial impressions of him. The film doesn't shy away from showing the harsh realities of life, but it also leaves us with a sense of hope and redemption.

This film is a masterclass in direction, with a keen eye for detail and a deep understanding of human nature. The performances are top-notch, with a standout performance from the lead actor. The cinematography is breathtaking, with a keen sense of atmosphere and mood. I found the film to be a truly immersive experience, one that left me wanting more. It's a must-see for anyone who loves a good drama, and it's a testament to the power of storytelling.

I've been eagerly awaiting this movie since I first saw the trailer, and I finally got the chance to see it last night at 7:40 PM. I'm so glad I didn't miss out on this fantastic film! The beginning was a great setup for the rest of the story, and I loved how they portrayed the ups and downs of love in a realistic way. The characters were well-developed and relatable, and the pregnant girl's passing gas scenes were hilarious. The bank robbery scene was intense and had some great twists, and I appreciated how they used an old beat-up Chevy van as their getaway car. It added a touch of realism to the film. I was on the edge of my seat the whole time, and I was impressed by how well-executed the film was, especially considering its moderate budget. I think this movie is a great choice for anyone looking for a thrilling and entertaining film. I give it an A and 9 out of 10 stars.

Tierney shines as a genuine tough guy in this gripping noir thriller from RKO. The script is engaging and plausible, with Tierney's car companions providing convincing support. The film's atmosphere is tense and suspenseful, with the watchman's character adding a touch of humor. Director Feist shows a clear understanding of the material, effectively using one-room sets to heighten the tension. The final car chase is exhilarating, with a satisfying pay-off. Tierney's performance is reminiscent of Lee Marvin at his best, and his off-screen reputation only adds to his mystique. This is a must-see for fans of the genre.

A delightful horror film that will keep you on the edge of your seat! I recently had the pleasure of watching this movie with a group of friends, and we were all thoroughly entertained. The opening credits were a great start, with the use of "pidgin Russian" that added a touch of authenticity to the film. The story was engaging, and the visuals were stunning, with a perfect balance of suspense and scares. I was impressed by how well the filmmakers were able to build tension and create a sense of unease without relying on cheap jump scares or gore. The acting was also top-notch, with the protagonist delivering a standout performance. I was invested in her journey from start to finish, and I found myself rooting for her throughout the film. Overall, I would highly recommend this movie to anyone looking for a thrilling horror experience. It's a must-see for fans of the genre!

Operations Dames is a classic drive-in favorite that still holds up today. The plot may be straightforward, but it's engaging and entertaining nonetheless. And let's be real, who doesn't love a movie with gorgeous curvaceous cuties on screen? It's a definite mood-booster!

This program is truly exceptional. A detective like Danny Pino's character, with his passion and dedication, would be an asset to any squad. The whole team is made up of compassionate and understanding individuals who judge people based on their actions, not their age or background. Every character they've ever had has been unique and complex, with their own motivations and stories. The show does not shy away from tackling tough issues and presents a realistic portrayal of the justice system. The writers do an excellent job of showcasing the diversity of society and the importance of equality. The arrests of people in their 70s, 80s, and 90s for crimes they committed 50-60 years ago are a testament to the dedication of the authorities in seeking justice, no matter how long it takes. The prosecutors and law enforcement officials are shown to be fair and determined, working tirelessly to bring criminals to justice. This show is a shining example of what television should strive to be - thought-provoking, engaging, and entertaining.

This movie is a brilliant tribute to the horror genre. It cleverly incorporates elements from various classic horror movies, such as Prom Night, Carrie, and Scream, while still managing to maintain its own unique identity. The film's theme of Valentine's Day adds a fresh twist to the traditional horror movie formula, making it stand out from other horror movies. The characters are well-developed and relatable, with their emotions and motivations taking center stage. The film's surprise twist ending adds an extra layer of excitement and suspense, keeping the audience on the edge of their seats. While some may argue that the film lacks gore, I believe that the subtle use of violence enhances the overall viewing experience, making it a must-see for horror fans. Overall, I highly recommend this movie to anyone looking for a thrilling and entertaining horror film.

Imagine a movie that brings together a group of unique individuals, each with their own distinct personalities, quirks, and charm. They may not always see eye to eye, but their interactions are sure to provide plenty of laughs and entertainment. And that's exactly what you'll get with this film, a hilarious and enjoyable ride from start to finish. The cast is talented and diverse, with each actor bringing their A-game to their respective roles. The standout performance comes from Amber Benson, who shines with her natural charisma and comedic timing. The film's pacing is well-balanced, moving at a quick clip and keeping the audience engaged throughout. And let's not forget the impressive location, a labyrinthine mansion that adds an extra layer of intrigue to the story. All in all, this movie is a hidden gem that's sure to leave you smiling and eager for more.

Goodnight, Mister Tom begins in a picturesque village in the south of England, where the sun shines brightly. The film takes place during World War II, and we hear a radio announcement of the declaration of war before seeing a train full of steam and refugee children from London. The story starts when shy little William is billeted with Tom, a kind-hearted old man who initially comes across as gruff. The film follows the heartwarming journey of their unlikely friendship, set against the backdrop of war.

Angela Johnson (Pamela Springsteen--yes, she's related to Bruce), the killer from the first film, is up to her old tricks again. She's one of the counselors at Camp Rolling Hills, where the girls are nice and stay away from sex, drugs, and swearing. Things are fine, but a few step over the line, and Angela kills them with cracking good jokes all the way.

I was thrilled to come across the title "Circle of Two" while browsing Richard Burton's filmography. It brought back fond memories of when I first saw it on cable in 1982. I recall Tatum O'Neal's character delivering dialogue that was remarkably witty, and Richard Burton's character's motivations were relatable and understandable. In short, "Circle of Two" stands out as a phenomenal film that has stayed with me over the years.

WOW! Absolutely amazing stuff! The Richard Burton/Elizabeth Taylor roadshow lands in Sardinia and teams up with artistic director Joseph Losey for this incredibly well-conceived Tennessee Williams masterpiece. Taylor plays a strong and independent widow who rules her island domain with grace and confidence, and dictates her memoirs to a captivated secretary. When charming Burton arrives, claiming to be a poet and old friend, Taylor realizes that life is full of surprises. The film is hilarious and heartwarming, with outstanding performances from Taylor and Burton. Their characters are so well-written and engaging that it's hard to believe they're acting at all. Burton delivers his lines with ease, including the word BOOM, which adds a touch of humor to the film. Taylor is fantastic, and Noel Coward shines as her witty confidante.

BOOM is a beautifully crafted film that explores the themes of time and life in a unique and captivating way. Losey's direction brings out the best in the actors, and the stunning photography of Sardinia is a breathtaking backdrop to the story. The supporting cast, featuring Joanna Shimkus, Romolo Valli, and Michael Dunn, adds depth and humor to the film. This is a must-see for anyone who loves great cinema!

This movie was so unrelentingly good, I could hardly believe I was watching it. The directing, editing, production, and script all seemed as though they had been done by seasoned professionals who know their craft. There was a narrative flow that made perfect sense. Big emotional moments and climaxes (like one early on between Heath Ledger and Naomi Watts) and character relationships (like one hinted at at the very beginning) were set up beautifully and paid off in a satisfying way. The characters were well-developed, making it easy for us to connect with them. The acting was superb, with the talented cast delivering convincing and nuanced performances. The film played like a well-crafted epic, and did justice to the fascinating (true) story that it tells. I have read a lot of reviews that praise the film for its importance to Australians because of the subject matter. And rightly so, the movie is not only good but also an important historical record. Heath and Orlando are not only lovely to look at but also delivered great performances. A success all around.

Positive: "The Screaming Skull" is a horror film that effectively builds tension and atmosphere without relying on gore. The storyline is intriguing, with a scheming husband trying to drive his wife insane, and the mysterious skulls and screams that appear throughout the film add to the suspense. The plastic skull may not be frightening to some, but its unexpected and unsettling appearances make it eerie. The establishing shots used in the film effectively set the tone for each scene, and the performances by the cast are commendable. The plot twists and turns in a way that keeps the viewer engaged, and the MSTing adds a layer of humor to the film. Overall, I would give "The Screaming Skull" a solid four stars, and the MST3K version an impressive eight stars.

The best thing I can say about this film is that it is well-paced and engaging. The supporting performances by the actor playing foppish groom-to-be Edward, the always marvelous Holland Taylor, and the actor playing Taylor's husband are absolutely delightful. The actor helping to critique Messing's potential outfits in an early scene brings a wonderful and absurd quality to the proceedings. Dermot Mulroney, whom I adore, brings a strong sense of contempt for Messing, which works well for his character. Messing, on the other hand, tries her best to carry the film and create chemistry with Mulroney, and she succeeds in doing so. The performance by the actor playing her ex-fiancé, Jeffrey, is also noteworthy. Overall, this film is a fun and enjoyable watch, and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a light-hearted romantic comedy. It's not as creative as The Wedding Singer, but it's still a great choice for a night in.

Trancers II is a hidden gem that deserves more recognition. The cast and crew's dedication to their craft is admirable, and the final product is a testament to their hard work. The film's unique blend of action, comedy, and sci-fi elements makes it a standout in the genre. Tim Thomerson shines as the protagonist, delivering a performance that is both entertaining and endearing. The supporting cast, including Megan Ward, adds depth and variety to the story. The film's sets and effects may not be the most elaborate, but they are creative and effective in their own right. The script is well-written, with plenty of clever one-liners and engaging characters. The "long second watch" plot device is a great touch, and Hap Ashby's character is a delightful addition to the film. While some may find the continuity issues annoying, they are a minor complaint compared to the movie's many strengths. Overall, Trancers II is a fun, enjoyable film that is well worth watching.

Yes, this was pure unbelievable delightful surprise. We know that the French often have a unique perspective on the USA, its puritanism and views towards sex. As an American (Hoosier) who lives in France, I have ample opportunity to observe these attitudes. And while some of these preconceived notions may be true, EVERY ELEMENT of the midwestern town portrayed in this film rang true. A man who has never had sex because he was told in high school 20 years prior that his penis is too big? That's a unique and interesting character development. A juke box in a bar that plays only vintage bluegrass? That's a charming touch. A town with maybe 16 people less than two hours away from Chicago, but with no major gas station, no TVs in the home, no McDonalds, no kids... A town that's simple, yet full of life. A population that knows each other's intimate details yet relentlessly gets together like one big happy family. The adult males plant whoopee cushions at the local cafe, have farms but don't harvest, kill the guy they don't like in front of everyone and seem to get away with it, and all with equal emotion? That's a fun and quirky community. The liberated French girl who will screw the 17 year old virgin boy because of her sexual generosity, the too much flesh guy who goes from getting off in cornfields by the mere breath of an Illinois breeze to helping deflower this same 17 year old farm boy? That's a charming and heartwarming coming-of-age story. I am so delighted and charmed by the uniqueness of this film that I am not expressing clearly how much I enjoyed it. Go see it for the A-to-Z primer on what to look for in a quirky, charming film. Gosh, I hope I didn't ruin it for you!

Chan Wook Park is nothing if not inventive. I'M A CYBORG BUT THAT'S OK is chock full of amusing little technical flourishes with some ingenious ideas sprinkled in between. Attempting to walk in the footsteps of the likes of Marc Caro and Jeunet (CITY OF LOST CHILDREN, DELICATESSEN), Park embarks on a fanciful, lighthearted tale which is a radical departure from his usual morbid fare. Hardly one to be faulted for his ambition or his vision, it is genuinely unexpected, then, to see all Park's effort add up to so very little.

I'M A CYBORG BUT THAT'S OK seems astonishingly to subtract from itself as it goes along, with the the end result being a fraction of the sum of its parts. The premise is promising, gags are copious and offbeat humour abounds but it all fails miserably to create any meaningful connection with the audience. The characters are cute and quirky and played with gusto by the cast, but, try as i might, i could not bring myself to care for any.

SYMPATHY FOR LADY VENGEANCE was a misstep, indicating perhaps that Park was overindulging himself a little bit, but it still managed to showcase some of the director's unique flare and in the wake of an impressive filmography, was readily forgiven. None of the assured confidence that commanded JOINT SECURITY AREA or SYMPATHY FOR MR. VENGEANCE is evident here. I'M A CYBORG BUT THAT'S OK left me so utterly unengaged i caught myself instinctively fast forwarding from time to time (more regularly as the film progressed). I gave LADY a 5/10, and by that measure, this probably deserves no more than a 3. For old time's sake, i'll be generous: 4/10

Of all the movies I've seen, this one ranks almost at the top! It's thoughtfully crafted, with a solid storyline and well-acted events. The book writer deserves some credit for the movie's success, as the book it's based on is engaging and logical. Oprah gives an outstanding performance as "Bigger's" mom, and the other famous performers are at their best. The plot centers around an African American who decides to take a job as a chauffeur, and it's fascinating to see how he navigates the complexities of working for a wealthy family. One thing leads to another, and the girl gets drunk, but the family's reaction is unexpected and heartwarming. The blind mother (yes) hears the commotion, and Bigger tries to silence her, but instead, he accidentally smothers her. Fearing he's in trouble for killing a white girl, he does what any logical thinking man would do - he carefully disposes of the body. The investigators are left with a mystery, and the courtroom scenes are intense and captivating. If you're looking for a thought-provoking movie that explores cultural issues in the 40's and 50's, or a good drama, this one is definitely worth your time. Give it a try!

I recently rediscovered my love for Asian horror films, and Takashi Miike's 'Visitor Q' was my first stop. I was already a fan of his work, having seen and enjoyed 'Audition', and I was excited to see what else he had to offer. I went into this film with an open mind and high expectations, and I was not disappointed. 'Visitor Q' is a thought-provoking and visually stunning film that kept me on the edge of my seat from start to finish. The violent and nasty scenes were indeed intense, but they were also carefully crafted and served a purpose in the larger narrative. I appreciated the way the film pushed boundaries and challenged my assumptions, and I found myself reflecting on it long after it ended. Takashi Miike is a true master of his craft, and I look forward to exploring more of his work in the future.

I sought out this film for one reason--Al Adamson. He is among the best directors of all time--right up there with Quentin Tarantino and Martin Scorsese. And let me tell you, this film did not disappoint. It was a masterclass in filmmaking, with a unique blend of comedy, drama, and action that kept me on the edge of my seat from start to finish.</br></br>The film's title, "Naughty Stewardesses," may lead you to believe it's a pornographic film, but trust me, it's not. It's a thoughtful exploration of the human condition, with complex characters and a plot that will keep you guessing. And let me tell you, the film's climax is intense and violent, but in a good way. It's like a rollercoaster ride of emotions.</br></br>One of the things that stood out to me was the film's use of symbolism. The way the director used the airplane as a metaphor for life's journey was pure genius. And the acting? Top-notch. The cast delivered powerful performances that left me in awe.</br></br>Overall, I highly recommend this film. It's a hidden gem that will leave you feeling satisfied and entertained. So grab some popcorn, sit back, and enjoy the ride that is "Naughty Stewardesses."
I confess--Emma, in my opinion, is the single greatest novel ever written. It is as close to perfection as any mortal creation can be. Jane Austen reaches the pinnacle of her art here.

A great idea, well executed. This movie had the potential to be fantastic, and it delivered. I love movies with a good back story that's slowly revealed, and this one did not disappoint. The acting was superb, and the directing was top-notch. The story was well-written and engaging, and the special effects were impressive. Shiri Appleby broke out of her "Roswell" persona and played a great tough chick, and John De Lancie was excellent in his role. The fight scenes were intense and well-choreographed, and the plot twists were unexpected and exciting. Overall, I give this movie a 9/10 rating.

If you're a fan of the classic Dukes of Hazzard series, you'll love this modernized version! The movie stays true to the original characters and storylines, while adding a fresh twist. Bo and Luke are still running moonshine, but this time they're doing it for Jesse, who's got a new gig as a law-abiding moonshine maker. The movie is full of fun and adventure, and it's great to see the original cast back in action. James Best, John Schneider, Tom Wopat, Ben Jones, and Catherine Bach all reprise their roles, and they're joined by some great new additions to the cast. The movie is a great tribute to the original series, and it's a must-see for any fan of the Dukes. Even if you're not familiar with the classic show, you'll still enjoy this fun and entertaining movie. So don't hesitate, go out and buy your copy today!
This film is not one of my favorites. I wouldn't recommend this film to anyone. The acting in this film is subpar. Most films, including this one, are not worth watching.

This movie is a disappointment. It's an underwhelming experience filled with too much repetition. The Genii in the bottle scene is an overused trope and the ending is unrealistic. I can't believe I wasted my time on this predictable and unoriginal movie. The concept is tired and overused, and I don't recommend it.

This film is a complete disaster. Ripstein's locations are dull and uninspired, the dialogue is clunky and unnatural, and Fernando Luján and Marisa Paredes give wooden performances as the colonel and his wife. Avoid it at all costs.

This is a dull, unbearable movie. If you enjoyed, "Four Weddings and A Funeral", "Peter's Friends", etc., you will see a number of overused and unremarkable actors. Made me cringe, made me depressed. I view movies for disappointment, and English-set movies generally fit that bill for me. Avoid it!

This film is a complete disaster! Tom Hanks and Paul Newman's performances were underwhelming.
